intro: Mitrasacme nidulifera, commonly known as the clustered mitrasacme, is a tropical plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its palmate leaves, which are typically divided into five to seven lobes. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, which are often borne on short peduncles. It is native to parts of Southeast Asia, including Malaysia and Indonesia, where it grows in humid, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
